009
010package imagingbook.common.regions;
011
012import static imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.NeighborhoodType2D.N4;
013
014import java.util.ArrayList;
015import java.util.Arrays;
016import java.util.List;
017
018import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
019import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.NeighborhoodType2D;
020import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntInt;
021import imagingbook.common.util.tuples.Tuple2;
022
023/**
024 * <p>
025 * Binary region segmentation based on a combined region labeling
026 * and contour tracing algorithm as described in [1].
027 * Detected regions and contours are 4- or 8-connected.
028 * See Sec. 8.2.2 of [2] for additional details.
029 * </p>
030 * <p>
031 * [1] F. Chang, C. J. Chen, and C. J. Lu. A linear-time component labeling
032 * algorithm using contour tracing technique. Computer Vision, Graphics,
033 * and Image Processing: Image Understanding 93(2), 206-220 (2004).
034 * <br>
035 * [2] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing - An Algorithmic
036 * Approach</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
037 * </p>
038 * 
039 * @author WB
040 * @version 2020/04/01
041 * @version 2022/09/28 revised
042 */
043public class RegionContourSegmentation extends BinaryRegionSegmentation implements ContourTracer { 
044        
045        static private final int VISITED = -1;
046        
047        private ByteProcessor ip;       // only used temporarily   
048        private List<Contour.Outer> outerContours;
049        private List<Contour.Inner> innerContours;
050        
051        /**
052         * Constructor. Creates a combined region and contour segmentation from the
053         * specified image, which is not modified. The input image is considered binary,
054         * with 0 values for background pixels and values &ne; 0 for foreground pixels.
055         * The 4-neighborhood is used by default ({@link DEFAULT_NEIGHBORHOOD}).
056         * 
057         * @param ip the binary input image to be segmented
058         */
059        public RegionContourSegmentation(ByteProcessor ip) {
060                this(ip, DEFAULT_NEIGHBORHOOD);
061        }
062        
063        /**
064         * Constructor. Creates a combined region and contour segmentation from the
065         * specified image and neighborhood type (4- or 8-neighborhood). The input image
066         * is considered binary, with 0 values for background pixels and values &ne; 0
067         * for foreground pixels.
068         * 
069         * @param ip the binary input image to be segmented
070         * @param nh the neighborhood type (4- or 8-neighborhood)
071         */
072        public RegionContourSegmentation(ByteProcessor ip, NeighborhoodType2D nh) {
073                super(ip, nh);
074                attachOuterContours();  // attach the outer contour to the corresponding region
075                attachInnerContours();  // attach all inner contours to the corresponding region
076        }
077        
078        @Override
079        public List<Contour.Outer> getOuterContours() {
080                return getOuterContours(false);
081        }
082        
083        @Override
084        public List<Contour.Outer> getOuterContours(boolean sort) {
085                Contour.Outer[] oca = outerContours.toArray(new Contour.Outer[0]);
086                if (sort) {
087                        Arrays.sort(oca);
088                }
089                return Arrays.asList(oca);
090        }
091        
092        @Override
093        public List<Contour.Inner> getInnerContours() {
094                return getInnerContours(false);
095        }
096        
097        @Override
098        public List<Contour.Inner> getInnerContours(boolean sort) {
099                Contour.Inner[] ica = innerContours.toArray(new Contour.Inner[0]);
100                if (sort) {
101                        Arrays.sort(ica);
102                }
103                return Arrays.asList(ica);
104        }
105        
106        // non-public methods ------------------------------------------------------------------
107        
108        @Override
109        int[][] makeLabelArray(ByteProcessor ip) {
110                // Create a label array which is "padded" by 1 pixel, i.e., 
111                // 2 rows and 2 columns larger than the image:
112                return new int[width + 2][height + 2];  // label array, initialized to zero
113        }
114        
115        @Override
116        boolean applySegmentation(ByteProcessor ip) {
117                this.ip = ip;   // temp. reference to ip
118                outerContours = new ArrayList<>();
119                innerContours = new ArrayList<>();
120                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {      // scan top to bottom, left to right
121                        int label = 0;                                  // reset label, scan through horiz. row:
122                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
123                                if (ip.get(u, v) > 0) { // hit an unlabeled FOREGROUND pixel
124                                        if (label != 0) { // keep using the same label
125                                                setLabel(u, v, label);
126                                        }
127                                        else {  // label == 0
128                                                label = getLabel(u, v);
129                                                if (label == 0) {       // new (unlabeled) region is hit
130                                                        label = getNextLabel(); // assign a new region label
131                                                        PntInt xs = PntInt.from(u, v);
132                                                        int ds = 0;
133                                                        Contour.Outer c = traceContour(xs, ds, new Contour.Outer(label));
134                                                        outerContours.add(c);
135                                                        setLabel(u, v, label);
136                                                }
137                                        }
138                                } 
139                                else {  // hit a BACKGROUND pixel
140                                        if (label != 0) { // exiting a region
141                                                if (getLabel(u, v) == BACKGROUND) { // unlabeled - new inner contour
142                                                        PntInt xs = PntInt.from(u - 1, v);
143                                                        int ds = (NT == N4) ? 2 : 1;
144                                                        Contour.Inner c = traceContour(xs, ds, new Contour.Inner(label));
145                                                        innerContours.add(c);
146                                                }
147                                                label = 0;
148                                        }
149                                }
150                        }
151                }
152                this.ip = null;
153                return true;
154        }
155        
156        // Trace one contour starting at Xs in direction ds     
157        private <T extends Contour> T traceContour(PntInt xs, final int ds, T C) {
158                final int label = C.getLabel(); // C: empty inner or outer contour              
159                
160                Tuple2<PntInt, Integer> next = findNextContourPoint(xs, ds);
161                PntInt x = next.get0();
162                int d = next.get1();    
163                C.addPoint(x);
164                
165                final PntInt xt = x;
166                boolean home = xs.equals(xt);
167                
168                while (!home) {
169                        setLabel(x, label);
170                        PntInt xp = x;
171                        int dn = (d + 6) % 8;
172                        next = findNextContourPoint(x, dn);
173                        x = next.get0();
174                        d = next.get1();
175                        // are we back at the starting position?
176                        home = (xp.equals(xs) && x.equals(xt)); // back at start pos.
177                        if (!home) {
178                                C.addPoint(x);
179                        }
180                }
181                return C;
182        }
183        
184        private static final int[][] delta = {
185                        { 1,0}, { 1, 1}, {0, 1}, {-1, 1}, 
186                        {-1,0}, {-1,-1}, {0,-1}, { 1,-1}};
187
188        // --------------------------------------------------------------------
189        
190        // Starts at point X0 in direction d0, returns a tuple holding
191        // the next point and the direction in which it was found if successful.
192        // Returns null if no successor point is found.
193        private Tuple2<PntInt, Integer> findNextContourPoint(PntInt x0, int d0) {
194                final int step = (NT == N4) ? 2 : 1;
195                PntInt xn = null;
196                int d = d0;
197                int i = 0;
198                boolean done = false;
199                while (i < 7 && !done) {        // N4: i = 0,2,4,6  N8: i = 0,1,2,3,4,5,6
200                        xn = x0.plus(delta[d]);
201                        if (!isInsideImage(xn) ||  ip.get(xn.x, xn.y) == BACKGROUND) {
202                                setLabel(xn, VISITED);  // mark this background pixel not to be visited again
203                                d = (d + step) % 8;
204                        } 
205                        else {  // found a non-background pixel (next pixel to follow)
206                                done = true;
207                        }
208                        i = i + step;
209                }
210                return (done) ? 
211                                Tuple2.from(xn, d) : 
212                                Tuple2.from(x0, d0);    // no successor found
213        }
214        
215        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
216        
217        private void attachOuterContours() {
218                for (Contour.Outer c : outerContours) {
219                        int label = c.getLabel();
220                        BinaryRegion reg = getRegion(label);
221                        if (reg == null) {
222                                throw new RuntimeException("could not attach outer contour to region with label " + label);
223                        }
224                        else {
225                                reg.setOuterContour(c);
226                        }
227                }
228        }
229        
230        private void attachInnerContours() {
231                for (Contour.Inner c : innerContours) {
232                        int label = c.getLabel();
233                        SegmentationBackedRegion reg = getRegion(label);
234                        if (reg == null) {
235                                throw new RuntimeException("could not attach inner contour to region with label " + label);
236                        }
237                        else {
238                                reg.addInnerContour(c);
239                        }
240                }
241        }
242
243        // access methods to the (padded) label array
244        @Override
245        public int getLabel(int u, int v) {     // (u,v) are image coordinates
246                if (u >= -1 && u <= width && v >= -1 && v <= height)
247                        return labelArray[u + 1][v + 1];        // label array is padded (offset = 1)
248                else
249                        return BACKGROUND;
250        }
251        
252        @Override
253        void setLabel(int u, int v, int label) { // (u,v) are image coordinates
254                if (u >= -1 && u <= width && v >= -1 && v <= height) {
255                        labelArray[u + 1][v + 1] = label;
256                }
257        }
258        
259        private void setLabel(PntInt p, int label) { // (u,v) are image coordinates
260                setLabel(p.x, p.y, label);
261        }
262        
263        private boolean isInsideImage(int u, int v) {
264                return (0 <= u && u < width && 0 <= v && v < height);
265        }
266        
267        private boolean isInsideImage(PntInt p) {
268                return isInsideImage(p.x, p.y);
269        }
270        
271}
